item.title: Help with 'action handler' & 'Clicking Buttons' - Teleports (with image)
item.dc:creator: @Ljelvin Ljelvin
item.description:
@Ljelvin wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:527505”]Why do people still do this shit:
c.getDH().sendOption5 (“monster1”, “monster2”, “monster3”, “monster4”, “monster5”);

The point of the dialogue handler is to handle dialogues
Thus why those statements had private access in that class.

In the dialogue handler, you want to add something like this into your switch statement (make sure the case ID isn’t being used).
(Also make sure to remove existing code and replace with mine…

case 666:
sendOption5 ("Rock Crabs", "Cyclopes", "Frost Dragons", "Brimhaven Dungeon", "More..");
c.teleAction = 1001;
c.nextChat = 0;
break;
case 667:
sendOption5 ("Monster", "Monster", "Monster", "Monster", "Monster");
c.teleAction = 1002;
c.nextChat = 0;
break;

And in action handler:

case 13615: c.getDH().sendDialogues (666, 0); break;
Then in your clicking button for the 5th option of the dialogue:

if(c.teleAction == 1001) c.getDH().sendDialogues(667, 0); [/quote]

Could you do the full clickingButtons for me as to what it will look like?
then ill change all my portals to that way- thank you.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with 'action handler' & 'Clicking Buttons' - Teleports (with image)

item.title: Help with 'action handler' & 'Clicking Buttons' - Teleports (with image)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Why do people still do this shit:
c.getDH().sendOption5 (“monster1”, “monster2”, “monster3”, “monster4”, “monster5”);

The point of the dialogue handler is to handle dialogues
Thus why those statements had private access in that class.

In the dialogue handler, you want to add something like this into your switch statement (make sure the case ID isn’t being used).
(Also make sure to remove existing code and replace with mine…

case 666:
sendOption5 ("Rock Crabs", "Cyclopes", "Frost Dragons", "Brimhaven Dungeon", "More..");
c.teleAction = 1001;
c.nextChat = 0;
break;
case 667:
sendOption5 ("Monster", "Monster", "Monster", "Monster", "Monster");
c.teleAction = 1002;
c.nextChat = 0;
break;

And in action handler:

case 13615: c.getDH().sendDialogues (666, 0); break;
Then in your clicking button for the 5th option of the dialogue:

if(c.teleAction == 1001)
c.getDH().sendDialogues(667, 0);

Read full topic
item.source: Help with 'action handler' & 'Clicking Buttons' - Teleports (with image)

item.title: Help with 'action handler' & 'Clicking Buttons' - Teleports (with image)
item.dc:creator: @Ljelvin Ljelvin
item.description:
@Ljelvin wrote:

Right, We’ll I have portals that link to the places above, however I want make it so when I click ‘More’ it opens up another menu with additional teleport locations.

ActionHandler
case 13615:
c.teleAction = 1001;
c.getDH().sendOption5 (“Rock Crabs”, “Cyclopes”, “Frost Dragons”, “Brimhaven Dungeon”, “More…”);
break;

Then I found out that that bottom ‘more’ is button 9194. So I opened a case with the correct teleaction that I set in actionhandler.

ClickingButtons
case 9194:

			if (c.teleAction == 1001) {
				//more options
			*******************************

I just don’t know how to make it having working teleports on the second menu, as It needs a new teleaction but I don’t know how.

I’ve tried ;

case 9194:

			if (c.teleAction == 1001) {
				//more options
                                                    c.getDH().sendOption5 ("monster1", "monster2", "monster3", "monster4", "monster5");

BUT it just teleports me to the same places as the previous menu. So I definitely think I need to make it read a new teleAction

Please help

REP++ to the person who helps me thank you!

Read full topic
item.source: Help with 'action handler' & 'Clicking Buttons' - Teleports (with image)
